org.timepedia.chronoscope.junit.canvas
Class Canvas

java.lang.Object
  org.timepedia.chronoscope.junit.canvas.Canvas
Direct Known Subclasses:
BrowserCanvas, FlashCanvas
public abstract class Canvas
extends java.lang.Object

Fundamental graphics rendering system of Chronoscope

Canvas is the fundamental graphcis rendering system of Chronoscope. Developed as an extended abstraction around the Browser (Safari) Canvas, it is used throughout Chronoscope. Developers wishing to extend Chronoscope to other rendering systems (Swing/Java2D, Flash, Silverlight, etc) should start here.

Canvas is an immediate mode abstraction which manages a collection of named layers on which draw calls occur. Canvas permits a command buffering abstraction through beginFrame() and endFrame(). beginFrame() may be used on some implementations to lock a surface for update. No actual rendering is guaranteed to take place until endFrame().

Prior to settling on CANVAS for browser based rendering, Timepedia prototyped a number of rendering techniques, including SVG, VML, Javascript->AppletCanvas, Flash, Silverlight, and Server-side. Our initial results were that SVG and VML implementations were currently too slow to support the interactivity we desired. We implemented CANVAS first, but we fully expect that Flash will become the preferred cross-browser Canvas for Chronoscope in the near future.

Constructor Detail

Canvas

protected Canvas(View view)
Method Detail

attach

public void attach(View view,
                   CanvasReadyCallback canvasReadyCallback)
Attach the layer to the UI tree and invoke callback if and only if it is ready for rendering operations. This is vitally important for plugin-based canvas implementations like Flash, Silverlight, and Applets where invoking native calls on unready plugins has caused browser crashes in our experience.

beginFrame

public void beginFrame()
Called before the start of a drawing sequence

canvasSetupDone

public void canvasSetupDone()
Called after all canvases and all layers created, only used by Flash

createLayer

public abstract Layer createLayer(java.lang.String layerId,
                                  Bounds bounds)
Create a layer with the given id and bounds. Creating a layer that already exists will return the previously created layer
